text: "War gives the right of the conquerors to impose any conditions they please upon the vanquished"
author: Gaius Julius Caesar

text: "War, as the saying goes, is full of false alarms"
author: Aristotle

text: "Ah! The generals! They are numerous but not good for much!"
author: Aristophanes

text: "It is the noblest and safest thing for a great army to be visibly animated by one spirit"
author: Archidamus of Sparta

text: "Brave men are a city's strongest tower of defence"
author: Alcaeus

text: "Against danger it pays to be prepared."
author: Aesop

text: "A dead enemy always smells good."
author: Aulus Vitellius

text: "He conquers who endures."
author: Persius

text: "Extraordinary rains pretty generally fall after great battles."
author: Plutarch

text: "I am more afraid of our own mistakes than of our enemies' designs."
author: Pericles

text: "Hannibal knew how to gain a victory, but not how to use it."
author: Maharbal

text: "Willing obedience always beats forced obedience."
author: Xenophon

text: "Soldiers do not like being under the command of one who is not of noble birth."
author: Onosander

text: "To an imperial city nothing is inconsistent which is expedient."
author: Euphemus of Athens

text: "In the moment of action remember the value of silence and order."
author: Phormio of Athens

text: "If a man does not strike first, he will be first struck."
author: Athenogoras of Syracuse

text: "Learn to obey before you command."
author: Solon of Athens

text: "The Spartans do not ask how many enemies but where they are."
author: Agis II of Sparta

text: "Come home with this shield, or upon it."
author: A Spartan mother equips her son

text: "A disorderly mob is no more an army than a heap of building materials is a house"
author: Socrates

text: "t is the noblest and safest thing for a great army to be visibly animated by one spirit"
author: Archidamus of Sparta

text: "War is sweet to those who have never experienced it"
author: Pindar

text: "The man who runs away will fight again"
author: Menander

text: "Nothing happens to anybody which he is not fitted by nature to bear"
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: "To lead untrained people to war is to throw them away"
author: Confucius
